Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.control

Class PIDFController

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.control.PIDFController
public class PIDFController extends Object
This is a PID controller (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PID_controller) for your robot. Internally, it performs all the calculations for you. You need to tune your values to the appropriate amounts in order to properly utilize these calculations.

The equation we will use is: u(t) = kP * e(t) + kI * int(0,t)[e(t')dt'] + kD * e'(t) + kF where e(t) = r(t) - y(t) and r(t) is the setpoint and y(t) is the measured value. If we consider e(t) the positional error, then int(0,t)[e(t')dt'] is the total error and e'(t) is the velocity error.

      The base constructor for the PIDF controller

    • PIDFController

      public PIDFController(double kp, double ki, double kd, double kf, boolean isAngleController)

    • PIDFController

      public PIDFController(double kp, double ki, double kd, double kf, double sp, double pv)
      This is the full constructor for the PIDF controller. Our PIDF controller includes a feed-forward value which is useful for fighting friction and gravity. Our errorVal represents the return of e(t) and prevErrorVal is the previous error.
      Parameters:
      sp - The setpoint of the pid control loop.
      pv - The measured value of the pid control loop. We want sp = pv, or to the degree such that sp - pv, or e(t) < tolerance.

    • PIDFController

      public PIDFController(double kp, double ki, double kd, double kf, double sp, double pv, boolean isAngleController)
